page.title: Authentication documentation
page.long_title: SimpleTest documentation for testing log-in and authentication

introduction.p: One of the trickiest, and yet most important, areas of testing web sites is the security. Testing these schemes is one of the core goals of the SimpleTest web tester.

section.name: basic
section.title: Basic HTTP authentication
section.p: Only basic authentication is currently supported and this is only really secure in tandem with HTTPS connections. This is usually enough to protect test server from prying eyes, however. Digest authentication and NTLM authentication may be added in the future.

section.name: cookies
section.title: Cookies
section.p: Basic authentication doesn't give enough control over the user interface for web developers. More likely this functionality will be coded directly into the web architecture using cookies and complicated timeouts.

Starting with a simple log-in form...

section.name: session
section.title: Browser sessions
section.p: Expiring cookies can be a problem. After all, if you have a cookie that expires after an hour, you don't want to stall the test for an hour while the cookie passes it's timeout.
